title: Al Shabab Club - Wikipedia
snippet: In the 1960s, everyone wanted to play and be part of the club, and after the request of Al Najmah FC and Al Marekh in 1967, they were united as one club and changed their name from Shabab Riyadh, to simply Al Shabab. The colors of the team were at first white and green, then they were changed ...

title: Shabab Al Ahli Club - Wikipedia
snippet: In 2017, the Dubai CSC and Al Shabab merged within Al Ahli, at which point the club renamed itself to Shabab Al Ahli. Al Ahli Club was established in 1970 when two local football teams Al Wehdah and Al Shabab (est. 1958) joined for a training camp in Egypt but decided to merge as one single club under first club president H.E.

title: Al-Shabab FC - Club profile | Transfermarkt
snippet: Al-Shabab Saudi Sport Club, Cultural and Social Club or Al-Shabab Club “for short” is a Saudi club based in the city of Riyadh, and it is considered the oldest club in the capital, Riyadh.
